review_title: Low pay but easy flexible work
job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Get paid to help people. When you aren't coaching you can do your own homework.
cons: The pay is barely above minimum wage, but that doesn't matter too much because you are paid to do your own homework a lot of the time.

job_title: Faculty in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Focus on students- strong culture.
cons: Don't take a lot of risks- so don't try many new ideas.

job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
-Earn money in school
-Get to work with other students & Professors
-Hours can work with class schedule
-Great Bosses
cons: -Can have no one show up to tutoring

job_title: ESports Coordinator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
- Great work hours
- Flexible Schedule
- Great Co-Workers
- Great Management
cons: - Can get extremely busy as a student

job_title: Educator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: They care about their students and employees
cons: It can be challenging to handle the work load.

review_title: Company IT manager didn’t even have the interview. Claims he was busy.
job_title: Information Technology in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Can’t think of any if they don’t hold up their end of coming to their own interviews…
cons: Everything… if a company can’t hold up their end and attend a interview they set… who will want to work here?

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: Instructor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: It is nice to be able to help students.
cons: Industry jobs pay better than teaching.

review_title: Opportunity for Self-Lead Project to Go on Résumé
job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I noticed an area in which I might help students by writing a program to make their lives easier. My supervising instructor was very encouraging and said that, as long as I kept up with my normal responsibilities, I might go ahead. You can turn this into a coding opportunity, which you can put on your résumé. You just have to find it.
cons: Neumont's payment system doesn't handle out-of-staters very well. You can get it to work in the end, but it's extra paperwork on your side.

review_title: Fantastic experience if it is right for you.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Hands-on project learning really enforces crucial skills.
cons: Work culture is harsh and not for everyone. Tuition is extremely expensive.

job_title: Resident Advisor (RA) in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Extremely flexible with work schedule, will work around your class times.
cons: Wages seem to be low for the position.

job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Flexible Scheduling. Flexible Location. Good Coworkers.
cons: A lack of communication happens fairly often.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The professors have all worked in industry and share their experience in order to help all students
cons: It is a private college so the price can be hefty

job_title: Student Associate in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: When there is free time, you can work on your schoolwork which has helped me out a lot. People are friendly and the schedule is flexible
cons: There may be times when you have to interact with rude people, but I haven't encountered anything like that.

job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Flexible hours for academic tutors
cons: No cons so far as tutor

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Caring, Project Based, Accommodating, Accelerated
cons: Expensive, Student Housing is a rip-off.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
- Fantastic faculty
- Project-based learning
- Growth mindset
- Healthy, friendly environment
cons:
- Extremely fast-paced
- Expensive
- Small school

review_title: Pros and Cons for Academic Coach
job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
-To tutor a class, you need to have passed it.
-Extremely flexible hours.
cons:
-Need to be a student of the school.
-Not many hours.

job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
The senior faculty is amazing. As an academic coach, you work directly under your professor, and you work very closely with them to guide students not just to learn the subjects, but to be interested in the subjects so they do their own research.
As a student myself, I had to go to coaches, and when I helped a student, it made me feel as if I was continuing the legacy of my predecessors.
cons: I went above and beyond my duties, staying late, reaching out to struggling students, offering extensive feedback on assignments,  grading mountains of work, and I got amazing reviews. I did not feel like I was rewarded for any of that. I didn't get a raise or a bonus, all I asked for was a nice company polo so I could feel like a part of the team, and I couldn't even get that when almost every other student position gets some kind of uniform.

job_title: Instructor in South Jordan, UT
pros:
Neumont is literally a 5 star ranking in all areas of this survey. Filling out the survey helped me realize further how wonderful of a place Neumont University is to work. All of my coworkers are fun and passionate about what we do. Management has a clear vision for where we are headed and does not deviate from it. I have more than a reasonable amount of resources available to deliver the best educational experience to our students.

The work is challenging, and preparing the best Computer Science graduates day in and day out takes a lot of work, but our hiring statistics of near 100% make me realize that we are succeeding at our lofty goals. Neumont is truly a dream job of mine, and I hope to continue delivering this fine experience forever.

There are not many jobs where you are so anxious to get to work each day that it is hard to sleep, but Neumont is definitely mine!
cons: Stress levels can get high when school is in session, but that just feeds my hunger for a good challenge.

job_title: Instructor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I really enjoy teaching and helping students learn. The school location is convenient/close to trax station. Administrative staff is extremely supportive. I am passionate about computer science, so while I was there, I really loved the teaching part of my job.
cons: The chief academic officer of the school is the reason I stopped teaching at Neumont. He is a former programmer that got a masters and doctorate through online degree mills. He makes promises that he has no intention of keeping, does not support his faculty, and takes credit for the accomplishment of others. Hands down, he was the worst boss I've ever worked with. Complete disaster of a manager.

review_title: Tutoring, its a hard job, but somebody has to do it.
job_title: Student Tutor in West Jordan, UT
pros:
The location as a student of Neumont  was great as a student. 
The hours were also great as a student.
The compensation plan was very fair and would have been almost worth my time at the higher level classes.
cons:
Hardly anyone came in for tutoring. 
Grading sucks unless you like to do it.
I could find a better paying job in the field that was just as flexible with the time and the location.
The hours became harder to come by in the end due to money restrictions.
It was only a part time job so there were no benefits to speak of.
I also did not like the time tracker, as it was ineffective in reporting my hours.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Lots of material to learn, loved the teaching, classrooms were nice, curriculum was very organized and planned out. I became a much better teacher because I spent so much time in the classroom.
cons: Extremely political environment in the academics department. School is owned by investors that are hyper-focused on making a profit over providing a solid education. My position was eliminated so they could hire on more part-time faculty at a lower pay rate. Worked out ok because I was already fed up and looking. The Dean of Academics was particularly unqualified and difficult to work with. He basically sat in his office and watched sports on his computer all day.

review_title: Fast Pace, hard working and a bang for your buck.
job_title: in South Jordan, UT
pros:
*Great networking with well named companies (ie, IBM, Microsoft, Google, REI systems)
*Start programming day one. 
*Actual group project experience
*Real Internship projects for the last three quarters
*Great Order Activities to allow the student to release some stress and have fun (Order names: Behind The Screen, Game Shark Order, The Game Gurus)
*Get your Bachelors degree in two and a half years instead of four.
cons:
*High stress levels.
*High work load.
*Some classes will be in "beta phase" which means  a lower chance of passing classes.
*No longer have specialized teachers teaching what they are specialized in.
*Will have constant schedule issues and can get behind on graduating easily.
*You are limited to the type of laptop you are allowed to use at Neumont University
*Neumont University does not focus on C++ or any other languages except C# and Java. (They have recently explored Objective C, but only in small doses)
*Neumont University does not focus on Databases. They only provide two classes, which only exposes you to MSSQL.
*Tutoring is no longer specialized and now generalized. Which means it's hard to find help from tutors for specific subjects.
*Quarter system has now been split into sprints. Which means you only have five weeks instead of ten to learn the same amount of information. This causes information to be lost within the cracks and just allows the student to be exposed to the language instead of actually learning it.
*The online courses are awful. They currently have "Sets and Probabilities", among other math classes as online courses.

review_title: Neumont University is a great place to learn and work.
job_title: Instructor in South Jordan, UT
pros:
Excellent faculty and staff.
Fun and open work environment.
A place that is dedicated to high-quality teaching and mentoring.
It gives you a real sense of accomplishment to work with our students.
Very flexible work schedule when class is out.
cons:
High work load during the academic quarters.
Grading and prep takes a lot of time.
Not many opportunities for promotion and advancement - it's a rather flat organization

review_title: Passionate staff, amazing product, burnout risk
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great product. They really provide the best Computer Science education available to students. Very innovative approach and they provide students with lots of support and resources. The staff and faculty are passionate about the mission of the school.
cons: Staff burn out happens periodically. The company is understaffed, and the existing staff fills in the gaps. Higher staff turnover and higher stress than other places I've worked. Also, small company, so there isn't much room for upward career growth.

job_title: Finance in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Neumont is like a family, if you do your best and are up front with management, they will bend over backwards to be understanding of any situation that arises. They truly care about the students who attend the school and their well being. I hear nothing but positive comments from the current students regarding their experiences at Neumont. Neumont provides both staff and students with a TRAX pass, which helps immensely with the commute to downtown SLC.
cons: The high tuition costs drive away many students, which is too bad.

review_title: I love this job -- funnest way to spend 8+ hours per day
job_title: Communications Manager in South Jordan, UT
pros: Great work-life balance, great students, great faculty, and an overall fun environment to spend my time.
cons: It's a LOT of work keeping up with all the unique demands of our students, their parents, and our industry partners and we have to walk a fine line to always ensure the quality of our graduates is unwavering.

job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great faculty and helping fellow students is always a good feeling. Supplemental pay for student life is always a plus.
cons: Sometimes faculty and students are unwilling to cooperate. Scheduling sometimes makes it difficult to get students together outside of class. Much of the job is "playing by ear"

review_title: Student at Neumont College of Computer Science
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Neumont strives to give it's students the ability to adapt and learn. Students are given real life experience in the field and graduate within 3 years allowing them to get in and out.
cons: Scheduling can be ugly and ridiculous. I sometimes have quarters where I spend 12~ hours in the building. It's culture is "Geed centered" meaning most students don't have the best hygiene.

job_title: Member in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good school, nice people, fun location in the heart of downtown SLC. You are surrounded by mostly eager students who want to learn computer science.
cons: Teaching load is heavy. You are in the classroom four hours a day typically. Not a lot of opportunities to develop expertise when you are constantly teaching and grading and developing new courses.

job_title: Bookstore Worker in South Jordan, UT
pros: easy job, can do homework while working, get to drive vans (sometimes), good pay
cons: communication. Hardly anything is communicated between the staff and the workers, students fail to listen to workers  because they think we have no power (kinda true but still). You only work 1 day a week :(

job_title: in South Jordan, UT
pros:
-Management cares about employees
-Fast paced work environment
-Rewarding
-Terrific compensation package
-Co-workers are fun to be around and work with
cons: -Long hours sometimes when school is in session

review_title: Could be great; Was great; No longer great
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
3 year graduation plan
Use to have great staff
Great location
cons:
No longer has great staff
Cater to students instead of focusing on providing a great education, while somehow ignoring criticism that works to fix the issue.

review_title: Good work environment but lacking communication
job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The hours are very flexible and the job is very fun, getting to work with students through issues.
cons: The communication was slow and rather rough. Often being told things last minute if at all.

job_title: Student Worker in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: There is a learning experience and everyone is like family
cons: Some lack of communication between departments.

job_title: Director of Financial Services in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The original founders had great ideas. Too bad they were never realized.
cons: Neumont is accredited by ACICS. ACICS is no longer recognized as an approved accrediting agency by the US Dept. of Education.

job_title: Faculty in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Honest, Ethical, Student-focuses, respectful atmosphere, excellent career-life balance

review_title: Okay at first, but goes down hill quickly
job_title: Academic Coach in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Work with peers and people that understand tech.
